boardgame.description: From Avalonhill web site:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;German tanks thunder into the snow-covered Ardennes forest, opposed only by a few unsuspecting divisions of exhausted American troops. As Axis forces plunge into the countryside, Allied troops must struggle to hold the front line in order to repel the all-out offensive. Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Allies: Battle of the Bulge challenges you to control territory and contend with supply shortages, while directing infantry, artillery, tanks, and aircraft in one of the most decisive conflicts of World War II._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Scheduled for release in November, 2006, Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Allies Battle of the Bulge will feature detailed game components including a new truck piece, a hex-based game board with new original artwork, and original artwork commissioned exclusively for the Battle of the Bulge game box. Other elements of this new Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Allies variant include crucial elements that were key factors in the historical battle, such as supply shortages and late-battle air support, mechanics for overland vs. road movement and randomized casualties of war_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Allies depicts Wacht am Rhein (Watch on the Rhein), the German code name for this counteroffensive that took place toward the end of World War II. The objective: to capture the port city of Antwerp. It was expected that the capture of Antwerp would cause a great disruption in the flow of Allied supplies, and also have the effect of breaking apart the great Anglo-American alliance._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;One player controls Germany, whose massive build up of forces have gone undetected by the Allies and are poised to unleash all their fury on the Allies. The other player controls the forces of the United Kingdom and the United States and they must stem the tide of German armor and hold their positions until reinforcements arrive._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Allies Battle of the Bulge is designed for two players and can be played in three to four hours. Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Allies Battle of the Bulge is the fourth Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Allies variant, following the successful Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Allies D-Day, Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Allies Europe and Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Allies Pacific versions. Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Allies Battle of the Bulge is available on November 17th, 2006._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Box Dimension: 15.8 x 10.5 x 3_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Avalon Hill (WOC 958170000) A Desperate Struggle for Victory in the Most Brutal Conflict of WWII German tanks thunder into the snow-covered Ardennes forest, opposed only by a few unsuspecting divisions of exhausted American troops. As Axis forces plunge into the countryside, Allied troops must struggle to hold the front line in order to repel the all-out offensive. Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Allies: Battle of the Bulge challenges you to control territory and contend with supply shortages, while directing infantry, artillery, tanks, and aircraft in one of the most decisive conflicts of World War II. Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Allies Battle of the Bulge features detailed game components including a new truck piece, a hex-based game board with original artwork. Other elements of this new Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Allies variant include circumstances that played key factors in the historical battle, such as supply shortages and late-battle air support, mechanics for overland vs. road movement, and randomized war casualties. Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Allies depicts Wacht am Rhein (Watch on the Rhein), the German code name for this counteroffensive that took place toward the end of World War II. The objective: To capture the port city of Antwerp. It was expected the capture of Antwerp would cause great disruption in the Allied supply lines, and threaten to fracture the great Anglo-American alliance. One player controls Germany, whose massive military build-up has gone undetected by the Allies, and are poised to unleash hell upon enemy forces. The second player controls the United Kingdom and the United States -- they must stem the tide of German armor and hold their positions until reinforcements arrive. Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Allies Battle of the Bulge, designed for two players, can be played in three to four hours. The game is the fourth Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Allies variant, following the successful Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Allies D-Day, Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Allies Europe and Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Allies Pacific versions. Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Allies Battle of the Bulge contains: 1 Game Board 1 Rulebook 12 Twelve-Sided Dice 1 Turn Marker 1 Victory-Point Marker 1 Axis Reinforcement Chart 3 Allies Reinforcement Charts 2 Turn-Order Charts 72 Total Axis Playing Pieces 85 Total Allies Playing Pieces 36 Front-Line Markers 6 Combat Strips 110 Supply Tokens 135 Plastic Chips

Avalon Hill (WOC 958170000) erman tanks thunder into the snow-covered Ardennes forest, opposed only by a few unsuspecting divisions of exhausted American troops. As Axis forces plunge into the countryside, Allied troops must struggle to hold the front line in order to repel the all-out offensive. Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Allies: Battle of the Bulge challenges you to control territory and contend with supply shortages, while directing infantry, artillery, tanks, and aircraft in one of the most decisive conflicts of World War II. Scheduled for release in November, 2006, Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Allies Battle of the Bulge will feature detailed game components including a new truck piece, a hex-based game board with new original artwork, and original artwork commissioned exclusively for the Battle of the Bulge game box. Other elements of this new Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Allies variant include crucial elements that were key factors in the historical battle, such as supply shortages and late-battle air support, mechanics for overland vs. road movement and randomized casualties of war Axis _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Allies depicts Wacht am Rhein (Watch on the Rhein), the German code name for this counteroffensive that took place toward the end of World War II. The objective: to capture the port city of Antwerp. It was expected that the capture of Antwerp would cause a great disruption in the flow of Allied supplies, and also have the effect of breaking apart the great Anglo-American alliance. One player controls Germany, whose massive build up of forces have gone undetected by the Allies and are poised to unleash all their fury on the Allies. The other player controls the forces of the United Kingdom and the United States and they must stem the tide of German armor and hold their positions until reinforcements arrive.

All game components are present (plastic playing pieces, markers, tokens, charts, combat strips, and dice). I didn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t count all of the plastic chips, but I think they are all there. During initial shipment, the game box was damaged. Along the upper left corner (looking at the box top), the box has been indented a bit (both box top and bottom). Damage is minor, box is still sound. The box top is starting to show signs of flaring along the long sides. In spite of that, the box is still in very good condition.
